titles.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 384) to reform the Troubled Assets Relief Program of the Secretary of the Treasury and ensure accountability under such Program, and for other purposes.

Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 384) to reform the Troubled Assets Relief Program of the Secretary of the Treasury and ensure accountability under such Program, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-3, by Mr. McGovern.
The resolution provides for further consideration of H.R. 384 with no further general debate.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 3.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 62.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 384 (TARP Reform and Accountability Act of 2009).
